title: Cath√©drale de l'Immacul√©e Conception , Style Classique Africain , tr√®s Lumineux !!
text:
La cath√©drale de Porto Novo , se situe dans le centre de la ville en venant de Cotonou par la RNIE1 , apr√®s avoir pass√© la place Toffa . Elle date de 1864 , mais est de conception moderne dans le style Africain , qui conserve les trois √©l√©ments classiques , nef avec collat√©raux mais sans transept  , Chevet , et clocher d√©port√© . En arrivant , on voit l'imposante fa√ßade √† deux niveaux , qui comporte une grande entr√©e avec trois portes √† voute en berceau . Au dessus , la fa√ßade prend la forme d'un chapiteau ouvert de lancettes en vitrail et d'un oculus . Les tons sont clairs avec un  fond rose p√¢le , aux bordures au ton ocre . La nef poss√®de des collat√©raux ouverts de grandes fen√™tres √† chapiteau en plein cintre tr√®s esth√©tiques . 
Au bout de la nef , le chevet , de forme arrondie , est √©clair√© par des lancettes en vitrail opaque blanc . Le clocher √† trois niveaux , est de section carr√©e en ma√ßonnerie avec , de sa base , des tourelles d'angle termin√©es par une coiffe  ocre . La partie basse du clocher , est surmont√©e par un √©l√©ment identique mais plus petit , coiff√© d'un √©dicule de section carr√©e , ouvert de petites alv√©oles supportant une grande croix ocre , sur tous les c√¥t√©s . 

En passant le porche , on peut voir un int√©rieur tr√®s lumineux , avec une grande nef √† voute en berceau , support√©e par des grands piliers peints en bleu ciel . Les d√©ambulatoires , qui bordent la nef , sont pourvus d'ouvertures qui illuminent l'√©difice  et de petites chapelles . L'autel de forme simple , se situe sur une estrade au milieu de l'abside ouverte de vitraux blancs . Le fond de l'abside , est couvert de carreaux bleu ciel et supporte une statue de la Vierge Marie avec des tentures aux couleurs du Togo . Ce lieu semble pour moi , id√©al pour le recueillement mais traduit aussi l'impression de la joie traditionnelle africaine .

placeInfo.name: Cathedrale Notre Dame de l'Immaculee Conception

translated_title: Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception, Classic African Style, very Bright!!
translated_text: Porto Novo Cathedral is located in the city center coming from Cotonou by the RNIE1, after passing Toffa Square. It dates from 1864, but is of modern design in the African style, which retains the three classical elements, nave with side aisles but without transept, apse, and offset bell tower. Upon arrival, we see the imposing two-level facade, which includes a large entrance with three barrel-vaulted doors. Above, the facade takes the form of a capital open with stained glass lancets and an oculus. The tones are light with a pale pink background, with ochre-toned borders. The nave has side aisles open with large windows with very aesthetic semicircular capitals. At the end of the nave, the apse, rounded in shape, is lit by lancets in opaque white stained glass. The three-level bell tower is square in masonry with, from its base, corner turrets finished with an ochre cap. The lower part of the bell tower is surmounted by an identical but smaller element, topped with a square-section aedicule, open with small alveoli supporting a large ochre cross on all sides. Passing through the porch, one can see a very bright interior, with a large nave with a barrel vault, supported by large pillars painted in sky blue. The ambulatories, which border the nave, are provided with openings which illuminate the building and small chapels. The altar of simple form, is located on a platform in the middle of the apse open with white stained glass windows. The back of the apse is covered with sky blue tiles and supports a statue of the Virgin Mary with hangings in the colors of Togo. This place seems to me to be ideal for meditation but also conveys the impression of traditional African joy.

translated_text: Located in the heart of the city of Porto-Novo in Benin, the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Immaculate is one of the oldest and most popular monuments in the city of Porto-Novo in Benin.

title: Beautiful repainted church
text: We were only able to walk outside of the church but it was beautiful. It has been repainted recently and is right across the street from a park. It's worth a quick visit if you're in the area.

title: Cathedrale Cotonou
text:
"Travel With VuAfrik at Benin"

The cathedral Notre Dame de Mis√©ricode, commonly known as Cotonou Cathedral is a Roman catholic cathedral, located near the Ancien pont bridge in Cotonou. It's noted for its distinct burgundy and white tiled architecture. Its tower stands towards the rear end left side of the main building. On 14 September 1955, It was promoted as the Metropolitan archidiocese of Cotonou.
